chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle
Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Death

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody A. Stephenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody A. Stephenson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cody A. Stephenson was found guilty of Homicide by Veh. Use-Control. Substance [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "D" Felony], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Death

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Edward F. Vlack March 28, 2016 - Restitution, Court Costs and Statutory Surcharges to be collected from prison wages.

-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant is entitled to 241 days credit under 973.155.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
***AMENDED***
Order signed by Judge Edward F. Vlack March 28, 2016 - restitution to be collected from prison wages and any balance remaining to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision.
$5279.93 restitution to be collected from prison wages and any balance remaining to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision in Count 4 Case #15CF19.
$1747.59 restitution to be collected from prison wages and any balance remaining to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision in Count 4 Case #15CF19.

***AMENDED***
Order signed by Judge Edward F. Vlack March 28, 2016 - costs to be collected from prison wages and any balance remaining to be collected by DOC as a condition of Extended Supervision.
$268.00 to be collected from prison wages and any balance remaining to be collected by DOC as a condition of Extended Supervision.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected from prison wages and any balance remaining to be collected by DOC as a condition of Extended Supervision.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1, 2, 3 and 5.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Cody A. Stephenson appeared from jail. Includes 15CF19 and 15CM306. Case called at 9:06 am. Agent Moll is also present. Parties have rec'd PSI. Court presents restitution request to the court. Ex #1 O/R. ADA Nieskes makes sentencing arguements.Victim's family and friends makes statements. Atty Chapmans makes sentencing arguements. Def's father and brother makes statement. Defendant makes statement. Court questions. Recess. Case recalled at 11:06 am. Court orders: 9 yrs i/c 10 yrs e/s with conditions - 
- Court Costs
- Restitution $7027.52
- DNA Surcharge
- AODA follow all treatment
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- 5 year revocation of Driver's License
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Restorative Justice if requested
- Random UA's and PBT's
- Pay Supervision Fees.
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Not eligible for challenge incarceration

Defendant entitled to credit for 241 Days under 973.155

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Evenson, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Cody A. Stephenson appeared from jail. Case called at 10:06.  Includes 15CM306, 15CF19. Atty. Chapman updates the court. ADA Nieskes agrees and agrees to competency agreement. Court finds DE is competent due to the stipulation.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 4 in 15CFR19. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire  that was signed and dated on June 29, 2015 and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 4  in  15CF19 in the amended information. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1, 2, 3, 5 in 15CF19 and 15CM306.  Crt orders a PSI. PSI to be completed by Aug. 28, 2015. PSI author to be present at the time of the hearing. Court revokes bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

SURETY NAME/S: Shawn McAleese

- To Report to the Jail every Wednesday, Friday and Sunday for PBT and UA Testing by 10:00 am. Testing to be paid for by Defendant

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- To check in with the Jail by phone by 10:00 am every Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday (715-386-4752)

- To live with S. McAleese
- To sign a Pre-signed Order of Extradition

- To be home by 10:00 pm on Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and by 11:00 pm on Friday and Saturday. S. McAleese to notify the Jail if he does return timely.
